definition: 4th note in pentatonic scale 五音[wu3 yin1], roughly sol/see also 徵|征[zheng1]
to invite/to recruit/to levy (taxes)/to draft (troops)/phenomenon/symptom/characteristic sign (used as proof)/evidence
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: Post-impressionism reflected a number of the same attitudes as symbolism in literature.
sentences.chinese: 後印象派反映了大量與文學象徵主義相似的態度。

sentences.english: The writer uses imagism and other figure of speech like simile etc.
sentences.chinese: 作者在詩中使用了象徵主義手法，和比喻等修辭方法。

sentences.english: The first chapter centers around the relationship between the Nine leaves School and symbolism.
sentences.chinese: 第一章探討九葉詩派與象徵主義的關係。

sentences.english: The film was much praised at the time for its visual symbolism.
sentences.chinese: 那部電影由於其視覺上的象徵主義而在當時大受褒揚。

sentences.english: LI Jin-fa is the representative of symbolism poetry in the early age of our country.
sentences.chinese: 李金髮是我國早期象徵主義詩歌的代表詩人。

sentences.english: These images are symbolistic argots about realistic prospect of Chinese society.
sentences.chinese: 這些影像是關於中國社會現實圖景的象徵主義的隱語。

sentences.english: Stevens is an outstanding poet among the symbolism poetic school.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂文斯是象徵主義詩派中著名的詩人。

sentences.english: Yeats saw history in symbolic and mystical terms.
sentences.chinese: 他以象徵主義和神祕主義看歷史。

sentences.english: He was closely associated with the literary movement of Symbolism and Decadence.
sentences.chinese: 他是密切相關的文學運動的象徵主義與頹廢。

sentences.english: All these would be welcome changes of substance and symbolism.
sentences.chinese: 所有這一切將是令人驚奇的事物和象徵主義的變化。

definition: Marcus Tullius Cicero (106-43 BC), famous Roman politician, orator and philosopher, murdered at the orders of Marc Anthony
Tolstoy (name)/Count Lev Nikolayevich Tostoy (1828-1910), great Russian novelist, author of War and Peace 戰爭與和平|战争与和平
Taiwan equivalent of 莫奈[Mo4 nai4]
